channel.title: Help Please
channel.description: Ok, I said earlier how it got to the "Starting Up, Please Wait..." part, and I used the Cd, and booted from the First Hard Disk, but now, I can only use the cd to boot from the Hard Disk, and I have an issue with my Screen Resolution. It stays on 640x480, and I can't change it, the Monitor is suposed to automatically install the drivers, but they're most likely exe's. I've checked the Lcd Screen's Website, and they have Drivers, but not for my Model, any place I should check to get this fixed? I can't do anything because of the Screen Resolution.

item.title: Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Fasga Fasga
item.description:
@Fasga wrote:

From looking at the Wine AppDB, it looks like iTunes v6 runs quite well through Wine. Although, I wouldn’t recommend that option unless it is an absolute must.

Read full topic

I see… Thank you for the help.

item.title: Help Please

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can’t install Itunes on linux, but pyMusique is even better I have heard.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Please
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Mmk Thx, I’ll check into that, as for the Booting Issue?

P.S. If I formatted my entire drive, and I own an Ipod, If I were to install Itunes, will my Ipod still be recognised? Or, am I going to have some issues.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Please
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Monitor drivers do exist (a driver cd came with my new monitor for win98 and older) but I have never had to use any…

In the past I have had to manually put in different resolutions that I know my monitor supported in my /etc/X11/xorg.conf file, if you know what you are doing you can edit that and restart (ctrl+alt+backspace restarts your x-server) Before you make any edits be sure to make a backup in case you screw something up.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Please
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Monitor driver’s aren’t needed (they don’t even exist afaik).

Your problem is much more likely to be a badly configured Xorg. Which distro are you using?

Read full topic

item.title: Help Please
